docs.lead_paragraph: HONOLULU -- If twice makes tradition, President Obama has a new one for Christmas Day: greeting troops during dinner at the Marine Corps Base Hawaii.
docs.abstract: The commander in chief hoisted babies, asked children what they got for Christmas and joked about his cut lip.

headline.main: Obamas Greet Marines at Christmas Dinner

docs.snippet: President Obama has often told the story of how he met his wife, Michelle, in Chicago when they worked at the same law firm. Now, fans of the first couple can visit the spot where they shared their first kiss.A historical marker was unveiled on We...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama has often told the story of how he met his wife, Michelle, in Chicago when they worked at the same law firm. Now, fans of the first couple can visit the spot where they shared their first kiss.A historical marker was unveiled on Wednesday at the site, outside a shopping center in Chicago. The plaque features a 2007 quote from Mr. Obama from an interview with O, the Oprah Magazine.
docs.abstract: Caucus column; site of Barack and Michelle Obama's first kiss is now marked in granite outside a shopping center in Chicago; the plaque features a photo of the couple kissing and a 2007 quote form Obama about their first date. Photo (M)m

headline.main: Honoring A Kiss: The First Couple's First Smooch

docs.snippet: Though the president has only hinted at what his next step might be, major publishers say the Obamas could earn millions from book contracts....
docs.lead_paragraph: Though the president has only hinted at what his next step might be, major publishers say the Obamas could earn millions from book contracts.
docs.abstract: White House Letter; literary agents say Pres Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama could draw $20 million to $45 million in post-presidency book contracts, expanding on Pres Obama's broad success as presidential author.

headline.main: Lucrative Book Deals Might Finance the Obamas’ Post-White House Life
headline.print_headline: Lucrative Book Deals Might Finance Obamas’ Post-White House Life

docs.snippet: In some schools, fewer children are participating in the school meals program and food waste is increasing because students are not eating the healthier alternatives....
docs.lead_paragraph: In some schools, fewer children are participating in the school meals program and food waste is increasing because students are not eating the healthier alternatives.
docs.abstract: Nation's schools report differing results in their attempts to comply with federal nutrition guidelines for meals served to some 30 million children across country; standards call for less sugar and sodium in foods and more fruit and vegetables, balance some schools are finding hard to achieve, in part because fewer children are participating in school meals program and increasing number of students are discarding healthier foods.

headline.main: Schools Report Varying Results in Their Efforts to Comply With Nutrition Guidelines
headline.print_headline: Schools Report Varying Results in Their Efforts to Comply With Nutrition Guidelines
